feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student clearly defined a financial problem and implemented an interactive AI app that produces stock movement analyses with a live demo and history/tests, demonstrating that the tool functions as a financial application. Minor limitations were noted but do not prevent the app from performing the required financial tasks.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly integrated an AI language model into a working app that produces substantive, user-focused explanations (demo and product description), demonstrating that AI adds value. Their discussion of implementation and reflection on limitations further supports effective, non-superficial integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So, I created an app. It's Why does my stock move? Get instant AI powered analysis of stock price movements. understand the news and market forces and whether it's short-term fluctuation or a long-term signal."

"The problem that I'm going to be solving today is when some people buy stocks or they're invested in stocks, they could see a price drop or price increase and they're like, man, what happened with this?"
"This is an easy app. People could just what happened this day, what happened that day, and they can find out easily what that information is."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified a real financial user problem (why stocks moved).  
- Implement: built and demoed an interactive app that analyzes stock price movements (example: Dow Jones March 12, 2020).  
- Reflect: acknowledged limitations (errors, cost) while confirming the app functions.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly defined a financial problem and implemented an interactive AI app that produces stock movement analyses with a live demo and history/tests, demonstrating that the tool functions as a financial application. Minor limitations were noted but do not prevent the app from performing the required financial tasks.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "it must use an AI language model. Open AI Claw Gemini whatever works whatever AI implemented. And I'm going to be using VO which is part of the app that I'm using to create the app."

"So, the problem that I'm going to be solving today is when some people buy stocks or they're invested in stocks, they could see a price drop or price increase and they're like, man, what happened with this?"

"So, I created an app. It's Why does my stock move? Get instant AI powered analysis of stock price movements. understand the news and market forces and whether it's short-term fluctuation or a long-term signal."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- DISCOVER: Student identifies a clear user problem (why stock prices move) and target users.
- IMPLEMENT: Student built an interactive app using VO and an AI language model and demonstrated it with a live example.
- REFLECT: Student comments on AI limitations (errors, cost), showing awareness of integration trade-offs.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly integrated an AI language model into a working app that produces substantive, user-focused explanations (demo and product description), demonstrating that AI adds value. Their discussion of implementation and reflection on limitations further supports effective, non-superficial integration.
